sections.name: Jason Black
sections.title: General Partner
sections.shortBio: Jason is a General Partner at RRE. He joined the team in 2014 as an Analyst and is the firm's fastest promoted investor and youngest General Partner.

children.text:
Jason is a General Partner at RRE. He joined the team in 2014 as an Analyst and is the firm's fastest promoted investor and youngest General Partner. In 2019, he was recognized on the Forbes 30 Under 30 Venture Capital list. In addition to his RRE responsibilities, Jason also serves as the Co-Director of the NYC VC—New York’s largest venture group that organizes networking and educational events for the growing NYC ecosystem.
Jason leads the firm's investments in crypto, B2B fintech, healthcare, developer tools, infrastructure platforms, industrial internet of things, and anything in traditional enterprise software.
Prior to joining RRE, Jason worked at Microsoft, where he developed Office’s first dedicated startup analysis pipeline.
Jason holds a B.A. from Harvard University where he studied Psychology and Computer Science. While there, Jason founded the Harvard College Tech Review, where he served as Editor-in-Chief, worked as a freelance designer and photographer, and co-founded two student startups.

sections.funFact: He has biked more miles than the circumference of planet Earth (24,901 miles).

sections.description: Anomaly is a precision payments platform that uses artificial intelligence and novel data sources to streamline healthcare billing and improve payment accuracy, a problem that costs the U.S. healthcare system more than $300 billion annually. Anomaly reduces friction between payers and providers by ensuring the payment process is accurate, streamlined, and trusted.

sections.name: Will Porteous
sections.title: General Partner and COO
sections.shortBio: Will is a General Partner with RRE Ventures and also serves as the firm's Chief Operating Officer. During his 23-year career as an investor, Will has served on the boards of more than 20 companies.

children.text:
Will is a General Partner with RRE Ventures and also serves as the firm's Chief Operating Officer. During his 23-year career as an investor, Will has served on the boards of more than 20 companies. He has been a leader in the transformation of the geospatial sector, most notably as Chairman of BlackSky (NYSE: BKSY) and as Lead Director of Spire (NYSE: SPIR). He is also a Director of Nanit, Paperless Post, Pattern, Pilot Fiber, Ursa, and Wave and a former Director of BuzzFeed (NASDAQ: BZFD). Will is also the Founder and Chairman of the Dockery Farms Foundation. From 2003 to 2018, Will served as an Adjunct Professor at Columbia Business School where he taught a popular course on venture capital.
Will holds an M.B.A .from Harvard University, an M.Sc. from the London School of Economics, and a B.A. with Honors from Stanford University.

sections.funFact: Will was one of the youngest people ever to climb Denali (Mt. McKinley), North America’s highest peak.

sections.name: Dennis Cherian
sections.title: Analyst
sections.shortBio: Dennis invests in bold entrepreneurs tackling problems they are deeply passionate about. He is open to investing in any industry, and encourages founders of all stripes to reach out.

children.text:
Dennis invests in bold entrepreneurs tackling problems they are deeply passionate about. He is open to investing in any industry, and encourages founders of all stripes to reach out.
Prior to joining RRE Ventures, Dennis spent nearly two years as an associate at the Boston Consulting Group. He also spent time as a fellow at Strategic Cyber Ventures (the early-stage arm of Hudson Bay Capital).
Dennis is a graduate of Villanova University, where he earned his BBA in Finance. Outside the office, you can find Dennis reading everything from biographies to sci-fi, tinkering with new tech, and exploring New York City's food scene.

sections.funFact: Dennis enters video game tournaments (he has yet to actually win, but he hasn't given up hope yet).

sections.name: McKenna Paulson
sections.title: Executive Assistant
sections.shortBio: McKenna serves as Executive Assistant to Will Porteous, Raju Rishi, and Jason Black.

children.text: McKenna is Chief-Get-It-Done for all things concerning Will Porteous, Raju Rishi, and Jason Black.  Prior to joining RRE in 2019, McKenna worked in Executive Recruiting at Kirk Palmer Associates.  A New Jersey native with family ties to the East Coast, McKenna graduated from Loyola University Maryland with a B.A. in Marketing. Today, she calls Manhattan her home, and outside of the office enjoys traveling, all things music, and spending time with family and friends.

sections.funFact: McKenna was named after “Makena Beach” in Maui, Hawaii. She had the chance to visit for the first time in 2019, just before the world shut down.

sections.name: Matt Gurin
sections.title: Director, Finance and Operations
sections.shortBio: Matt is a member of the RRE’s operations team, supporting various finance and platform initiatives for the firm.

children.text: Matt is a member of the RRE’s operations team, supporting various finance and platform initiatives for the firm. He spends his time monitoring fund and portfolio company performance, enabling transactions and investor requests, and focusing on the data and systems of the firm. Prior to joining RRE, Matt worked as a Client Finance Analyst at 360i, a digital marketing agency, and prior to that, he worked with The Distinguished Programs Group as an Associate Analyst.

sections.funFact: Matt likes to cook and try new recipes.

sections.name: Jenna Williams
sections.title: Executive Assistant
sections.shortBio: Jenna serves as Executive Assistant to James D. Robinson III.

children.text: Jenna serves as Executive Assistant to James D. Robinson III. Prior to joining RRE Ventures, Jenna was a 20-year veteran of Time Inc. working for some of the most iconic brands in media, with the bulk of her tenure spent at Sports Illustrated. You may think you remember her from high school, your neighborhood, your favorite restaurant or the freezer section of your supermarket—because you know Jenna from her 100+ commercials for TV and radio.

sections.name: Tricia Han
sections.title: Entrepreneur in Residence
sections.shortBio: Tricia is an Entrepreneur in Residence at RRE.

children.text: Tricia is an Entrepreneur in Residence at RRE. She brings a wealth of operating experience in consumer technology, digital media, marketplaces and ecommerce, having previously served as CEO of MyFitnessPal and CEO of Daily Burn and in various executive leadership roles at IAC, WebMD, and DailyCandy. As an EIR, Tricia reviews new investment opportunities, works with current portfolio companies, and is developing potential new company ideas, leveraging her extensive product background.
In addition to her work at RRE, Tricia currently serves on the boards of the Empire State Realty Trust (ESRT), Door.com (DOOR), and the Hudson Lab School.
Tricia holds a B.A. from Cornell University. Outside of the office, Tricia can be found reading, running, and spending time with her family.

sections.funFact: Tricia learned to drive the family tractor at age 10.

sections.name: Ibis Hanzel
sections.title: Fund Accountant
sections.shortBio: Ibis serves as RRE's Fund Accountant, where she focuses primarily on the accounting of our funds, and also serves as Controller for the Management Company.

children.text: Ibis serves as our Fund Accountant, where she focuses primarily on the accounting of our funds and also serves as Controller for the Management Company. Prior to joining RRE Ventures in 2004, Ibis was a Senior Accountant at Marcum LLP, a public accounting firm in New York City. Ibis has participated in audits, prepared corporate tax returns, and handled the tax needs of partnerships across the advertising, medical/ legal, broker/ dealer, real estate, and entertainment industries among several others. Ibis holds a B.S. from Northeastern University.

sections.funFact: Outside of the office, Ibis enjoys traveling and attending traditional cooking classes.

sections.name: Raju Rishi
sections.title: General Partner
sections.shortBio: Raju is a General Partner at RRE.  He invests in passionate and tenacious entrepreneurs who are building category-defining businesses.

children.text: Raju invests in passionate and tenacious entrepreneurs that are building category-defining businesses. He has a bias for companies with deeper technology stacks, but always prioritizes exceptional teams over exceptional technology. His current areas of focus include Enterprise Technology, Healthcare IT, and AI. Raju looks for startups that are disrupting massive markets by solving complex and meaningful problems.

Before joining RRE Ventures, Raju was a Venture Partner at Sigma Prime Ventures in Boston. Most of his career, however, was spent as an entrepreneur and operator. He was the founder of several startups in the mobile and enterprise software sectors. Prior to that, Raju held executive roles at AT&T and Lucent. Due in part to his operating background, Raju likes to be involved with his companies, and wants to be the first call for an entrepreneur when things are going well or not so well.

Raju is a graduate of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, where he holds B.S. and M.S. degrees in Materials Science and Engineering.  Raju is a lifelong hacker & very few electronic products in his home remain unaltered.  Outside of the office, Raju can be found sipping a fine whiskey or tequila and spending time with his wife, four kids, and German Shepherd.

sections.funFact: Close inspection during zoom calls with Raju may result in the discovery of his eclectic whiskey & tequila collection.

sections.description: HYLA Mobile, formerly eRecyclingCorps, is the world's leading provider of carrier-grade wireless device trade-in solutions. founded in 2009 to provide a scalable model to repurpose and reuse perceptually obsolete devices, HYLA partners with global wireless carriers and retailers to provide instant, in-store trade-in credit. HYLA renews devices to stringent certification standards and sells them to consumers in developing countries at an affordable price thereby bridging the digital divide. HYLA is projected to complete more than 6 million wireless trade-ins worldwide in 2012. HYLA now operates in ten countries worldwide and is a founding member of the Device Renewal Forum.

sections.name: Stuart Ellman
sections.title: Founder and General Partner
sections.shortBio: Stuart is a Co-Founder and General Partner at RRE Ventures, which he founded with Jim Robinson in 1994.

children.text: Stuart is a Co-Founder and General Partner at RRE Ventures, which he founded with Jim Robinson in 1994. Stuart is currently a director of Domain Money, Fi, Groups, Kindbody, One Drop, Silver Tree Labs, Complete Sleep and Staircase and is involved with Prove, Bark & Co. and Ladder Life. Stuart has helped to incubate and found a number of startups including Prove, Silver Tree Labs, Complete Sleep,  Staircase, Shake and eCoverage. Previous investments include Business Insider, Proofpoint, Clarity Money, Kroll Bond Ratings, Bread and Clearpath Robotics. From 2003-2018, Stuart taught at Columbia Business School where he is also on the investment board of the Tamer Fund. Since 2021, Stuart serves on the Nelson Center Advisory Council at Brown University, and since 2022 serves on the Board of Directors for Wesleyan University. In addition, Stuart was named to Insiders' 2021 and 2022 Best Early Stage Investor list, was named to Insiders' 50 most important VCs in New York for 2022 and 2023, was the recipient of the #CoachingColumbia Award (inspired by Bill Campbell's mentorship), and was named to the Top 100 Harvard Business School Alumni In Finance & Investing. In addition to his professional work, Stuart served as President of 92Y from 2012-2015 and Chairman from 2015-2018. During his tenure, Stuart was instrumental in launching initiatives including #GivingTuesday, a global day of giving; 7 Days of Genius, a multi-platform, multi-venue festival of ideas; 92Y’s first MOOC, “How to Change the World,” offered in partnership with Wesleyan University; 92YOnDemand, a new content website with more than 103,000 followers; and an expanded partnership with NYCEDC to host the NYC Venture Fellows program. Previously, Stuart worked at Morgan Stanley, McKinsey, and Dillon Read. Stuart holds an MBA with Distinction from Harvard University and a BA in Economics from Wesleyan University, where he was a Gilbert Clee Scholar and a Horace White Fellow.

sections.funFact: After investing in the leading dog startups for over a decade including Bark and Fi, Stuart was a hard core cat person.  He just got his first dog in 2022.

sections.name: James Robinson III
sections.title: Founder and Former General Partner
sections.shortBio: Jim is a Founder and General Partner at RRE Ventures and a longtime American business leader.

children.text:
Jim is a Founder and General Partner at RRE Ventures and a longtime American business leader.  Over the past quarter-century of his investing work with RRE, he’s focused on emerging enterprise technology with a special concentration in financial services technology, leading investments in companies like Avant, Nerdwallet, First Performance, Net Abstraction and OnDeck.  He has a keen focus on risk management, especially in cyber security and crypto.
Alongside his professional responsibilities, Jim brings his extensive leadership experience to several notable institutions.  He has served since 1970 as both a board member and chairperson of the Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center, and he is Chairman Emeritus of the Partnership for New York City. He also served as a board member of the Coca-Cola Company from 1975 to 2015 and was a long-time board member and chairperson of Bristol-Myers Squibb.
Prior to founding RRE, Jim is best known for his work as CEO and Chairman of American Express, where he guided the company through many changes from 1977 to 1993. He previously worked in various positions at American Express, White Weld & Co. and Morgan Guaranty Trust Company. Jim holds an M.B.A. from Harvard Business School and a B.S. from Georgia Institute of Technology. Outside of the office, he can be found doing 500 sit-ups each morning, going to the gym and spending time with his wife and kids.

sections.funFact: Jim has the strongest abdominal and core muscles in the partnership.

sections.name: James Robinson
sections.title: Founder and General Partner
sections.shortBio: Jim is a Co-Founder and General Partner at RRE Ventures. Over the last thirty years he has invested in over sixty companies and served on the boards of more than forty-five.

children.text:
Jim is a Co-Founder and General Partner at RRE Ventures. Over the last thirty years he has invested in over sixty companies and served on the boards of more than forty-five. His core investment focus is on businesses transforming industries by leveraging network effects, intelligence, and decentralization—including early bets on new technologies in mobile payments and blockchains.
Jim is currently a Director of Abra, CAMP, Netsertive, Noom, Securrency and TheSkimm, and a Board Observer at Bitpay and HYPR. In addition, he led early investments in 21e6, Bitnomial, DCG, Lightning Labs, Paxos and Ripple.
Jim has been recognized on the Forbes Midas List as one of the top one hundred venture capitalists, as well as by Institutional Investors' list of Top Fintech Investors. Previously, he worked at H&Q Venture Capital, JP Morgan& Co., and founded IV Systems.
Aside from his RRE responsibilities, Jim serves on the boards of the Empire State Realty Trust (ESRT), the Forward Party, and the Partnership Fund for New York City. He is an early supporter and Senior Advisor to the Chamber of Digital Commerce in Washington DC.
Jim holds an MBA from Harvard and a combined degree in Computer Science and Business Administration from Antioch College. He supports several charitable endeavors, and is a father of four, an inventor, and a dog person.

sections.funFact: Jim is a former NYC taxi driver.

sections.name: Jay Hass
sections.title: Strategic Advisor
sections.shortBio: Jay is a Strategic Advisor at RRE, and is responsible for investor relations as well as supporting our portfolio companies on business development and corporate development opportunities.

children.text:
Jay is a Strategic Advisor at RRE, and is responsible for investor relations as well as supporting our portfolio companies on business development and corporate development opportunities.
Previously, Jay spent 22 years at Brown Brothers Harriman as a Managing Director, where he established and managed BBH's Alternative Investments Group, which encompassed private equity, hedge, Asian equity and real estate funds with assets of $1.3 billion and approximately 1,300 limited partners. Before entering the investment world, Jay spent several years in national political campaign management as well as in advertising.
Outside RRE, Jay serves as a Partner and CFO at AlleyCorp; CEO of Ionic Recording Company; and as a director of Bridgetown Holdings Ltd. (NASDAQ: BTWNU) and Bridgetown 2 Holdings Ltd. (NASDAQ: BTNB). He serves as an advisor to Raftr, Inc., Decode_M and the M. Night Shyamalan Foundation.
Jay graduated from Princeton University with a B.A. in Politics and completed the CFA Institute’s Investment Management program at Harvard Business School.  In his free time Jay is an avid runner and cyclist, having completed 22 marathons including multiple finishes at Boston and Death Valley.

sections.name: Johanna Concepcion
sections.title: Office Manager
sections.shortBio: Johanna serves as Office Manager in the RRE Florida office.

children.text: Johanna serves as Office Manager in the RRE Florida office. Prior to joining RRE, Johanna worked in Human Resources and Training in the Philippines.  When not working, Johanna loves to read, watch movies, play pickleball, and dance.

sections.funFact: Grover of Sesame Street is Johanna's favorite character, being a gentle & lovable monster.  Just recently, she played a game for several rounds just to win the biggest (ever) original Grover stuffed toy!

sections.name: DeAnna Supplee-Evans
sections.title: Administrative Assistant
sections.shortBio: DeAnna serves as RRE's Receptionist and Administrative Assistant.

children.text: DeAnna serves as RRE's Receptionist and Administrative Assistant.  When she is not warmly greeting you at our New York City office, you can find her on theatre stages around the city and regionally across the country.  She holds a B.A. in Theatre Arts and English from the University of Pennsylvania (Go Quakers!) and an M.F.A. in Acting from the Actors Studio Drama School.

sections.funFact: DeAnna is somehow terrified of flying, but loves to travel. She just visited her 28th country and is already planning for #29.
